DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether heated humidified high flow nasal cannula (HHHFNC) is effective as a treatment of obstructive sleep apnea syndrome (OSAS) compared to continues positive airway pressure (CPAP) treatments in children and to compare their adherence and compliance.
DOC.brief_title: Heated Humidified High Flow Nasal Cannula for Children With Obstructive Sleep Apnea
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterias: Age: 016 years old. Refered for treatment with non invasive ventilation. Diagnosed with OSAS and AHI>=5 There are no exclusion criteria
DOC.keyword: Heated Humidified High Flow Nasal Cannula (HHHNC)
